result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Antonio Torres Rojas

records.addlTxt:
3:28 PM Defendant Juan Antonio Torres Rojas appeared by video, in custody and with interpreter Fred S (sworn).  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes appeared by video for Juan Antonio Torres Rojas.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund and Maggie Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Hayes acknowledges rec. complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Court advises DE of his right to counsel.  Atty Hayes states the DE hasn't applied for PD appt yet but he has been provided the PD information sheet so he can call to see if he does qualify.  Court advises DE of his right to prelim - time limits waived.  State makes bail argument - agrees to signature bond w/no contact provision.  Atty Hayes responds - objects to the no contact noting DE lives in the same residence as C.L.L.T.  Court asks for clarification re: the relationship.  Court orders $2,500.00 signature bond.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with C.L.L.T. or her residence or her employment or her children or her grandchildren. ( F.T., J.A., T.A.M. and Y.M.).  May return to any shared residence one time upon prior notice and with law enforcement to retrieve belongings if necessary.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on January 11, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
